organizations: Manitoba Moose of the American Hockey League
lead_paragraph: Luc Bourdon, a promising rookie defenseman with the Vancouver Canucks, was killed Thursday when his motorcycle struck a tractor-trailer near his hometown of Shippagan, New Brunswick. He was 21. His death was confirmed by his sister Eve Bourdon and stepmother Maryse Godin. Both declined further comment when reached at the family’s home in Shippagan. Bourdon was the first-round draft pick of the Canucks in 2005, the 10th overall selection. He split time this season with the Canucks and the Manitoba Moose of the American Hockey League.
